property.name: ID Number
property.description: Feature identification code as marked on tag

property.name: Grid Square
property.description: Letter code as marked in south-west corner of square

property.name: Brief description
property.description: A few word description of an ‘other’ type of hearth or hearthstone, e.g. fish hearth, emu eggshell hearth, silcrete hearthstones

lookup.term: {none} No charcoal visible
{diss} Disseminated charcoal: fine particles of charcoal dispersed through the hearth feature or its sedimentary matrix
{flecks} Small fragments of charcoal dispersed through the hearth feature or its sedimentary matrix
{lumps} Fragments or lumps of charcoal occur within the hearth or its sedimentary matrix

property.name: Proportion of material that remains in situ
property.description: Select the proportion of visible shell material that remains in situ

lookup.term: {most} The majority of the visible shell material is in situ
{some} At least some of the shell is in situ
{surface} No shell material is embedded in sediment
{recement} The shell material appears to be in situ, but there is a high likelihood that it is actually cemented in redeposited sediment
{ambiguous} The shell material appears to be in situ, but it is impossible to say whether it is actually recemented

property.name: Modification of heat-retainer hearths
property.description: Select the degree of post-exposure modification of the heat-retainer hearth:

lookup.term: {none} Hearth structure is largely maintained, hearthstones are in good conditions
{frag} Material highly fragmented
{dispers} Material widely dispersed from in situ or clustered part of hearth
{polish} Hearthstones are smoothed and glossy material

property.name: Modification of non-heat retainer hearths
property.description: Select the extent of post-exposure modification to non- heat retainer hearths:

lookup.term: {none} Hearth structure is intact and hearth material is largely unweathered
{weather} Hearth material has started to weather and/or crumble, but the feature remains largely intact
{incrill} Incipient rill network extending to edge of hearth or cutting back into it
{rill} Well-developed rills are cutting through the hearth
{undercut} Underlying sediment has been removed through erosion
{gul} Feature is bisected by an established gully

property.name: Topographic Setting
property.description: Where on the lunette exposure is the midden located?

lookup.term: {platform} Broad, flat platform exposure
{Lessthan_Six_Degrees} Slightly sloping surface
{Six_To_Twelve_Degrees} Moderately sloping surface
{Greaterthan_Twelve_Degrees} More steeply sloping surface
{shallrill} Within a shallow rill
{rillfloor} In the floor of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
{rillwall} In the wall of a deep rill (strong, vertical rilling in clay-rich sediments)
{ridge} On a narrow ridge in heavily eroded area
{ridgerill} Feature in a heavily eroded area is cut by deep rills and straddles rill wall and rill flow
{shalgulfl} In the floor of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
{shalgulwal} In the wall of a gully less than 1.5m wide or deep
{deepgulfl} In the floor of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
{deepgulwal} In the wall of a gully greater than 1.5m wide and deep
{residtop} Flat surface on top of a residual
{residside} In the side of a residual
{chanfloor} In the floor of a modern outwash channel
{chanwall} In the wall of a modern outwash channel

property.name: Sediment Type
property.description: What are the sediments in that encase the midden, or upon which they are immediately lying?

lookup.term: {redsoil} Soil of a reddish colour
{brownsoil} Soil of a brownish colour
{redsand} Sandy sediments of a reddish colour
{brownsand} Sandy sediments of a brownish colour
{whitesand} Sandy sediments that are clean and whitish
{othersand} Sandy sediments that are of another colour
{greenclay} Clay sediments of a greenish colour
{otherclay} Clay sediments of another colour (usually brown)
{sandyclay} Sandy clay
{alternat} Alternating layers of sand and clay
{claylens} Distinct clay lens within other sediments
{sandlens} Distinct sand lens within other sediments
{cobble} A relatively continuous bed of cobbles or coarse gravel
{gglag} A surface lag of carbonate derived from Golgol sediments
{carblag} Any other surface lag of hard carbonate nodules
{ggC} In situ soil carbonate (C-horizon) associated with Golgol sediments
{Chorizon} In situ nodular soil carbonate in any other sediment
{carbsoft} In situ soil carbonate in a diffuse horizon
{carbpavemt} Well developed in situ soil carbonate forming a pavement
{carbrework} A carbonate lag that has been reworked and reburied

property.name: Vulnerability to Erosion
property.description: How vulnerable is the midden, based on the midden type and size, sediment characteristics and topographic setting?

lookup.term: {low} On a relatively stable, flat surface or gentle slope that is not being eroded by rills
{moderate} Wider area is being eaten away by ongoing erosion, e.g. near edge of platform exposure, gully head, expanding rill system
{high} High probability of erosion within a few years, e.g. relatively steep slope with incipient rills, or unconsolidated sandy sediment
{extreme} Extreme weather events may result in rapid removal of material, e.g. edge of eroding residual or deep rill, in gully wall, on a steep, slope-washed surface

property.name: Palaeotopographic Setting
property.description: Where is the midden located in relation to the original dune morphology?

lookup.term: {foredune} Stratigraphic layers are sloping towards the lakebed
{backdune} Stratigraphic layers are sloping towards the hinterland
{beach} An area of rounded cobbles or gravels in distinct horizon
{lakebed} Lakebed sediments
{crest} Crest of dune, stratigraphic layers slope away, towards both lakebed and hinterland
{spit} Projection from dune into lakebed
{indet} Indeterminate

property.name: Notes
property.description: Any additional information worth noting that has not been covered by the recording – for example, combinations of associated material not on the menu options.

property.name: Associated material
property.description: If material other than shell is associated, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {lacust} Lacustrine material other than mussel (fish bone, otoliths, etc.)
{terrbone} Terrestrial bone material
{indetbone} Bone that cannot be identified as terrestrial or fish (e.g. fragments too small)
{eggshell} Emu, Genyornis or other eggshell
{artefacts} Chipped, unmodified or ground stone
{otherwork} Other worked or transported material

property.name: Associated lacustrine material
property.description: If lacustrine material other than mussel is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {fishbone} Fish bone
{otoliths} Fish otolith
{gastrolith} Crustacean gastrolith
{exoskel} Crustacean exoskeleton

property.name: Burnt lacustrine material
property.description: If lacustrine material other than mussel is present in the midden, is any of it burnt?

lookup.term: {Yes}
{No}

property.name: Associated terrestrial bone
property.description: If terrestrial bone is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been identified (see Old Bone Reference Manual for more illustrations)

lookup.term: {mammal}
{birdbone}
{reptile}
{other}
{unident} Cannot be identified by recorder
{undiag} Fragment is undiagnostic

property.name: Burnt terrestrial bone
property.description: If terrestrial bone is present in the midden, is any of it burnt?

lookup.term: {Yes}
{No}

property.name: Associated eggshell
property.description: If eggshell is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {emu} Emu eggshell
{genyo} Genyornis eggshell
{other} Other eggshell, clearly not emu or Genyornis (e.g. duck, swan)
{indet} Indeterminate eggshell, features unclear due to surface modification

property.name: Burnt eggshell
property.description: If eggshell is present in the midden, is any of it burnt?

lookup.term: {Yes}
{No}

property.name: Associated stone artefacts
property.description: If stone artefacts are present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {cs} Chipped stone
{um} Unmodified stone
{ground} Ground stone

property.name: Associated chipped stone artefacts
property.description: If chipped stone is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {ru} Retouched/utilised artefact
{co} Core
{deb} Flaking debris, including whole flakes, broken flakes and angular fragments
{hammer} Hammerstone
{indet} Indeterminate

property.name: Associated retouched artefacts
property.description: If retouched or utilised chipped stone is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {notch} Notched artefact
{scraper} Other type of scraper
{backed} Backed artefact
{unifpt} Unifacial point
{bifac} Bifacially flaked artefact
{otherru} Any other type of retouch or use-wear

property.name: Associated unmodified stone
property.description: If unmodified stone is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {nodule} Nodular or rounded cobble
{slab} Angular piece
{pebble} Small nodular or rounded piece, unlikely to be useful for artefact manufacture

property.name: Ground ston
property.description: If ground stone is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {millstone} Large, concave to flattish ground surface
{muller} Convex surface with facet from back and forth motion
{mortar} A circular or oval basin
{pestle} A cobble with convex of flattish ground end
{grooved} Single or multiple grooves
{amorph} Poorly defined, or small, discontinuous ground surface, not matching any of the above
{undiag} Fragmentary, not complete enough to distinguish nature of ground surface

property.name: Ground stone status
property.description: If ground stone is present, is the ground material...

lookup.term: {whole}
{fragment}

property.name: Raw materia
property.description: If stone artefacts are present in the midden, select those types of raw material that have been observed

lookup.term: {silcfine} Fine-grained silcrete
{silccoarse} Coarse-grained silcrete
{silcgran} Granular silcrete
{qtzite} Quartzite
{qtz} Quartz
{ironst} Ironstone
{sandst} Sandstone
{other} Other material

property.name: Associated other worked (or transported) material
property.description: If other worked or transported material is present in the midden, select those of the following that have been observed

lookup.term: {bone} Worked bone
{shell} Worked shell
{ochre} Unworked ochre
{facetochre} Facetted ochre
{qtzxtal} Unworked quartz crystal
